text:
I have a serious problem with Lenya at
http://olr.kbs.uni-hannover.de:8080/lenya/

When I try to publish a page (using MSIE 6.0) the browser literaly waits 
forever for a complete response (I have stopped waiting after about five 
minutes). But using another browser window at the same time shows that the page 
was published as it should be.
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de

text:
I tried again today. The problem persists.

Forever is "only" a few minutes. What takes so long?!
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de

text: no known cause unfortunately. we need more data to resolve this one.
creator: gregor@apache.org

text:
I also can reproduce this problem at my installations here at home.
IMO this is a serious problem.

May the release manager decide :)
creator: roku@apache.org

text:
There probably is a connection with bug 26564 ("WGet has windows file locking 
issues"). I see the WGet file locking error when I try to publish a page with 
1.2RC4 on Windows 2000. The browser does not wait forever in that case.
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de

text:
i disabled export on the default publication. and please, no bug reports how
export is crucial and blocks the release.. :)
creator: gregor@apache.org

text:
This problem is reproduceable with the demo system at
http://olr.kbs.uni-hannover.de:8080/lenya/
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de

text:
roku do you think the flow changes you made could have a positive impact on this
one too?
creator: gregor@apache.org

text:
Dunno, but there are some more places where I get blank pages after action.
I will have a look sooner or later,´.
creator: roku@apache.org

text:
Gregor, re the flow integration; what I did is very specific to the ditor
integrations and usecases, but maybe the underlying problem (see bxe save+exit
takes forever) is the same. The problem there was reading file A, transforming
it and writing it back in one pipeline. The problemis that file A is not closed
after reading and the SourceWritingtransformer then tries to write to the file.

White pages are caused by inappropriate client side redirects via redirect.xsl.
I exchnaged them with <map.redircet-to...> or inn flow with cocoon.redirectTo.
creator: roku@apache.org
gregor@apache.org
text: tested on ie 6 and ff, not able to reproduce

creator: roku@apache.org
text: Seems to work. But exporting is disbaled on publish.
